try pytraj online:


Parallel calculation¶

Contents

  • Parallel calculation
    • Disclaimer
    • single action with single trajectory
      • Example
      • Supported methods for pmap
      • Supported methods for openmp
      • Rule of thumb for choosing pmap or openmp?
      • pmap doc
    • multiple actions with multiple trajectories

Disclaimer¶

This is experimental design, syntax might be changed.

single action with single trajectory¶

pytraj use python multiprocessing, so users don’t need to install extra package.

Example¶

In [1]: import pytraj as pt

In [2]: traj = pt.iterload('data/tz2.ortho.nc', 'data/tz2.ortho.parm7')

In [3]: pt.pmap(pt.radgyr, traj, n_cores=4)
Out[3]: 
[(0, array([ 18.9111,  18.9365]), 2),
 (1, array([ 18.8497,  18.9045]), 2),
 (2, array([ 18.8569,  18.8892]), 2),
 (3, array([ 18.943 ,  18.8888,  18.9167,  18.8707]), 4)]

# auto-join the data
In [4]: pt.pmap(pt.radgyr, traj, n_cores=4, dtype='dict')
␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀Out[4]: 
OrderedDict([('RoG_00000',
              array([ 18.9111,  18.9365,  18.8497,  18.9045,  18.8569,  18.8892,
                      18.943 ,  18.8888,  18.9167,  18.8707]))])

Supported methods for pmap¶

In [5]: for method in supported_pmap_methods:
   ...:     print(method)
   ...: 
NH_order_parameters
angle
center_of_geometry
center_of_mass
dihedral
dist
distance
distance_rmsd
get_velocity
ired_vector_and_matrix
mean_structure
mindist
molsurf
multidihedral
native_contacts
radgyr
rmsd
rmsd_nofit
rmsd_perres
rotation_matrix
search_hbonds
vector
watershell

Supported methods for openmp¶

In [6]: for method in supported_openmp_methods:
   ...:     print(method)
   ...: 
closest
dssp
pairwise_rmsd
rdf
replicate_cell
watershell

In [7]: print("")
␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀

Rule of thumb for choosing pmap or openmp?¶

Always try to install pytraj and cpptraj with -openmp flag. If method supports openmp, use openmp.

pmap doc¶

API

multiple actions with multiple trajectories¶

Only works with Python 3.

In [8]: from pytraj.parallel import PJob

In [9]: tasklist = []

In [10]: tasklist.append((pt.radgyr, traj))

In [11]: tasklist.append((pt.molsurf, traj, '@CA'))

# perform each action on each CPUs (total 2 CPUs)
In [12]: pjob = PJob(tasklist)

In [13]: print(pjob.compute())
[(0, array([ 18.9111,  18.9365,  18.8497,  18.9045,  18.8569,  18.8892,
        18.943 ,  18.8888,  18.9167,  18.8707])), (1, array([ 458.5141,  459.6478,  456.5469,  467.7294,  462.4591,  458.7033,
        454.4051,  455.1502,  468.7057,  456.0059]))]
